intro: Heracleum concanense var. stocksii, commonly known as the Indian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant features tall, slender stems and large, umbrella-like compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in spherical inflorescences, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in open grasslands and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
